description: [Africa CDC] Addis Ababa -- On 13 May 2024, the Government of South Africa announced an outbreak of Mpox following the confirmation of a case from Gauteng province with no travel history to countries with an active Mpox outbreak. As of today, a total of 7 laboratory-confirmed cases and two deaths (Case Fatality Ratio - CFR: 28.6%) were reported from Gauteng (3/7), KwaZulu-Natal (3/7), and Western Cape (1/7) provinces. The cases were confirmed at the National Institute for Communicable Diseases (NICD) of South Africa.
title: Africa: Mpox Outbreak in South Africa

description: [UN News] The global fight to tackle female genital mutilation (FGM) is being undermined by the movement of some girls across national borders and beyond to undergo the procedure, the UN human rights office (OHCHR) warned in a new report published on Friday.
title: Africa: Global Efforts to End Female Genital Mutilation Undermined By 'Vacation Cutting'

description: [DW] Analysts see the new unity government comprising the ANC and the opposition DA as a chance to stabilize the country.
title: Africa: South Africa Unity Government - a New Political Era Dawns

description: [ANGOP] Luanda -- Angola's tourism potential is being displayed in Cape Verde at an Investment Forum that began Wednesday, with the aim to attract new investors and create an identity as an attractive tourist destination in the country, ANGOP has learnt.
title: Africa: Angola Displays Tourism Potential in Cape Verde

description: [African Union] The African Union Commission department of Partnerships &amp; Resource Mobilization convened the 20th Senior Officials Meeting of the Coordination Committee of the Africa-Arab Partnership on the 13th June 2024 at the African Union Headquarters in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. The objective of the Meeting of Senior Officials was to assess and review the outcomes on the implementation of Decisions on the 4th Africa-Arab Summit which took place in Malabo, Equatorial Guinea in 2016 and discuss the implementation of
title: Africa: AU Commission Convenes 20th Senior Officials Meeting of the Coordination Committee of the Africa-Arab Partnership

description: [WHO-AFRO] In the midst of a raging cholera outbreak in Sorgin, Nsanje, Kaombe Sugar Company finds itself at the epicenter of a public health crisis. Field workers, including long-time employee Michael Kajobe, face dire sanitation challenges as the absence of toilets and water washing mechanisms in sugarcane plantations forces them to resort to unhygienic practices.
title: Africa: Zeroing in On Purposive Targeting in Oral Cholera Vaccination Campaign

description: [Africa Check] Don't be scammed! World Food Programme isn't offering cash assistance via this dubious website
title: Africa: Don't Be Scammed! World Food Programme Isn't Offering Cash Assistance Via This Dubious Website

description: [ISS] African delegates arrived in Seoul last week without a collective plan. But did they need one?
title: Africa: First Korea-Africa Summit - Another Missed Opportunity for Africa

description: [Malaria Consortium] Once a localised threat, dengue fever has rapidly escalated into a global health emergency, putting nearly half the world's population at risk across more than 100 countries. As our world becomes increasingly interconnected through travel and trade, and in the face of climate change, the danger posed by this debilitating mosquito-borne disease looms larger than ever before.
title: Africa: The Escalating Global Dengue Crisis - a Call for Unified Action

description: [Capital FM] NIGERIA -- Former President Uhuru Kenyatta has underscored the vital role of education in Africa's development, advocating for substantial investments in education and capacity building to secure a prosperous future for the continent.
title: Africa: Uhuru Says Education Crucial to Africa's Development

description: [MAP] Addis Ababa -- Morocco's interest in artificial intelligence (AI) was highlighted on Thursday in Addis Ababa before the Peace and Security Council (PSC) of the African Union (AU).
title: Africa: AU-PSC - Morocco's Interest in Ai Highlighted in Addis Ababa

description: [New Times] Rwandan music creators and other stakeholders involved in the music industry have welcomed Recording Academy's expansion plan to Africa and Middle East, saying that 'it is a win' for Rwanda's music industry.
title: Africa: Music Creators Laud Recording Academy's Expansion Plan to Rwanda

description: [Business Day Africa] Airtel Telesonic, the wholesale arm of Airtel Africa, has announced the successful activation of the 2Africa submarine cable system, enhancing connectivity across the continent.
title: Africa: 2africa Submarine Cable Activated, Boosting African Connectivity

description: [Vanguard] The Minister of State Petroleum Resources (Gas), Mr. Ekperikpe Ekpo, has listed adoption of gas technology and innovation, shaping effective policy frameworks, unlocking financing avenues, nurturing capacity building, and cultivating entrepreneurship as measures that would the future Nigeria's and Africa's energy landscape.
title: Africa: Petroleum Minister Lists Measures to Improve Gas Sector in Nigeria, Africa

description: [GAVI] Geneva -- In historic step, preventive Ebola vaccination to become norm in highest-risk countries Gavi will also support lower-income countries for routine administration of human rabies vaccine for post-exposure prophylaxis, as well as multivalent meningococcal conjugate and hepatitis B birth dose vaccines Dr Sania Nishtar, CEO of Gavi: "Gavi's ability as an Alliance to protect health and save lives hinges on its ability to ensure vaccines are accessible, as quickly as possible, to who that need them the most. The
title: Africa: Gavi Announces Launch of Preventive Ebola, Routine Multivalent Meningitis, Human Rabies, and Hepatitis B Birth Dose Vaccination Programmes

description: [VOA] Borgo Egnazia, Italy -- U.S. President Joe Biden is in Apuglia, Italy, meeting with leaders of the Group of Seven wealthy democracies Thursday, aiming to address global economic security amid wars in Europe and the Middle East and U.S. rivalry with China.
title: Africa: Biden, G7 Leaders Focus On Ukraine, Gaza, Global Infrastructure, Africa

description: [New Times] Never has the world experienced a plethora of complex challenges as it is experiencing today. The world is suffering from the after-mass effects of the Covid-19 pandemic, two wars in the Middle East and Eastern Europe, climate change events, and even a trade war between China and the U.S.
title: Africa: How Can Africa Navigate Increasing Polycrises?

title: Africa: The G7 Cannot Afford to Ignore Africa

title: Africa: $100 Billion Investment Needed Annually to Meet Africa's Electricity Demand - Official

description: [The Conversation Africa] As the world prepares for the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, can we maintain faith in the nonpolitical ethos of the event? The Montreal Olympics Games in 1976 stands out, among others, as a clear instance of the games being used for political ends.
title: Africa: June 16 Uprising - How a Massacre in South Africa Led to Africa's Boycott of the 1976 Olympics

description: [UN News] Violence against children caught in armed conflict reached "extreme levels" last year, with a "shocking" 21 per cent increase in extreme violations, UN Secretary-General António Guterres said in a report published on Thursday.
title: Africa: UN Reports 'Shocking' Rise in Violations Against Children in Conflict in 2023
